p: MIC and MBC values defined by the microwell dilution method were tested against E. coli, P. fluorescens and A. bohemicus Gram-negative bacteria strains and K. marina and B. cereus Gram-positive bacteria strains. The lowest MIC (13.28 mg/mL) and MBC (26.56 mg/mL) values, which correspond to the highest antibacterial activities, were reported for P. abies EO against A. bohemicus and for A. alba EO against A. bohemicus and B. cereus with 12.82 mg/mL (MIC) and 25.64 mg/mL (MBC).
